intro: Phyteuma hemisphaericum var. platyphyllum, commonly known as the broad-leaved phyteuma, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It features basal rosettes of broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces tall, slender stems with clusters of bell-shaped, pink or purple flowers. The plant blooms in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant flowers and architectural form.
